Johann Sebastian Bach

The Well-Tempered Clavier, Book 2, BWV 870–893

c. 1739–1742

[Wikipedia] · [IMSLP]

The collection exists in two primary versions: the first (denoted A in the Neue Bach-Ausgabe) based on the original London manuscript and the second (denoted B) preserved in copies by Johann Christoph Altnickol. The versions are broadly similar; the Altnickol (B) version is given on these pages.

Some individual preludes and fugues also exist in further versions; these are described below.

In BWV1,2,2a, the main collection is identified under BWV 870–893, with the London version of the prelude of no. 1 denoted separately as BWV 870b, and earlier versions listed under BWV 870a, 872a and 875a. In BWV3, the main collection is identified under BWV 870.2–893.2, with earlier versions listed under BWV 870.1, 872.1, 875.1 and 876.1.

Recommended editions

  • Neue Bach-Ausgabe (Bärenreiter) · V, 6/2 · BA 5086-01 · Das Wohltemperierte Klavier II · ed. Alfred Dürr [versions A and B, also including further versions of BWV 870, 872, 875–876, 884 and 886]
  • Associated Board · ed. Richard Jones
  • Bärenreiter · BA 5192 · ed. Alfred Dürr [including further versions of BWV 870, 873 and 886]
  • Bärenreiter · BA 5200 · Präludien, Fughetten aus dem Unfeld des Wohltemperierten Klaviers II · ed. Alfred Dürr [earlier versions of BWV 870, 872, 875–876 and 884]
  • Henle · HN 16 · ed. Yo Tomita
  • Henle · HN 17 · ed. Yo Tomita
  • Henle · HN 1016 · ed. Yo Tomita
  • Peters · EP 11503 · Clavier-Büchlein für Johann Christian Bach · ed. Christoph Wolff [two earlier versions of BWV 870]
  • Peters · EP 11510 · Kleine Präludien, Fugen und Fughetten · ed. Christoph Wolff [earlier version of BWV 870]
  • Wiener Urtext · UT 50051 · ed. Walter Dehnhard

1. C major, BWV 870, Prelude (first final version)

Unlike the rest of the collection, the preludes of the first London (A) and second Altnickol (B) versions are quite different: both are therefore given here. In the Schmieder catalogue, these versions are identified under BWV1,2,2a 870b (London version) and BWV1,2,2a 870 (Altnickol version); BWV3 lists both under 870.2.

The prelude and fugue also exist in an earlier version (BWV1,2,2a 870a; BWV3 870.1) as part of a collection of five preludes and fughettas (alongside BWV 899, 900, 901 and 902).

Finally, the Neue Bach-Ausgabe also gives three further versions that are not given here: the earlier pair in an embellished version according to a copy by Johann Caspar Vogler, the London version of the prelude according to a copy by Wilhelm Friedemann Bach, and a version of the prelude taken between the London and Antnickol versions.

Duration: 2' 30"

Difficulty: 3

3. C-sharp major, BWV 872, Prelude

The prelude exists in an earlier version, and the fugue in two earlier versions according to copies by Johann Friedrich Agricola (together BWV1,2,2a 872a/1, although BWV1,2 omit the second earlier version of the fugue; BWV3 872.1).

Duration: 2'

Difficulty: 3

6. D minor, BWV 875, Prelude

This prelude exists in an earlier version (BWV1,2,2a 875a; BWV3 875.1) that is given below. The Neue Bach-Ausgabe also gives a further version taken between the London (A) and Antnickol (B) versions.

Duration: 1' 30"

Difficulty: 3

6. D minor, BWV 875, Prelude (earlier version)

Duration: 1'

Difficulty: 2

6. D minor, BWV 875, Fugue

The Neue Bach-Ausgabe gives an earlier version of this fugue according to a copy by Johann Friedrich Agricola.

Duration: 2'

Difficulty: 3

7. E-flat major, BWV 876, Fugue

The Neue Bach-Ausgabe gives an earlier version of this fugue, a fughetta in D major (BWV3 876.1), according to a copy by Johann Friedrich Agricola.
